content.description: Sit-start left on large jug, right hand on bulbous crimp.  More right to an unique pinch and throw to a sloping dish.  Stick the dish and jugs take you to the top
content.location: Same boulder as Shoot to Kill, start 6 feet to the left

content.description: Start with a flake for the left hand and an incut jug/gaston for the right-hand.  A scrunched sit-start leads to more jugs and an easy slab.
content.location: Same boulder as Shoot To Kill, start 8 feet to the left

climbs.name: Vato Loco Chupacabra AKA The So Cal Yolked Tour!!!

content.description: Climb the super gnar core crimps and xenoliths, out and over the overhanging scoop/wave !
content.location:
Located on the west face of The Little Brother Boulder.

One and a half body lengths to the right of Bean and Cheese Burrito. Stand start.

content.description: Sit start on the slopy shelf with obvious left hand side pull jug. Move up and right on good holds, make a big move to a incut seam with your right hand. From this point, Mantle up to the rounded lip.
content.location: On the same boulder as shoot to kill. On the south west side of the hilltop area. On the left side of face

content.description: Start with right hand on slopey side pull dish, left hand on bumps up high. Right foot on high edge, pop to slot crimp in the horizontal seam. Finish it up!
content.location: On the south west side of the hill top area. Problem faces the west. In center of face

content.description: Likely not FA for this face, but maybe for this beta?  Start with low handholds before grabbing first right jug to increase quality/difficulty. Start on right jug for shorter V0
content.location: Up on da hill!  Graffiti looks like it says "Leske", which was interesting, but it is not my paint!

content.description: Wide hands start.  Big jug on the top-out (don't pull it too hard, kinda hollow!) Great quick fun for Melrose beginners.  *There are a lot of variations to get up this boulder
content.location: I'm not going to describe exactly where this boulder is, as this was my 5th or 6th time to Melrose, and I was surprised to find this gem hidden in plain sight.  Easier to find when coming from south entrance.

content.description:
This climb follows the obviouse slab-potato chip shaped flake.

Three variations., all with cruxes being down low.
content.location: North face of furthest northern boulder at hilltop cirque.

content.description:
This cool tech dyno, sends the right side margin of the Shoot To Kill face. Crumy feet with a funky micro pinch/thumb press, will allow you to throw for the super bucket up and left at apex of boulder. Now mantle!

Can be done static but probably a bit harder.
content.location: Bulging rounded scooped arête, located on the right side of the Shoot to Kill Face.

content.description: Cool little Arête problem in the middle of the ghetto!
content.location: North West Arête of Ghetto Boulder.

content.description: Start matched layback on big rail.  Reach out to left pinch, then right hand to sloper rail, top out.  *eliminate big holds to the right
content.location: Same face as "Plain Sight"

content.description: Short but technical face up the steepest part of the Ghetto Boulder.
content.location: Cool short west face of Ghetto Boulder. Just right of Low Rider Arête.

content.description:
Creative technical crimping on great edges, brings you to the same top out as Papas Fritas.

Great powerful yet delicate climb! :)
content.location:
Bean and Cheese Burrito climbs the stellar crimps, two body lengths to climbers right of Papas Fritas.

North West Side of Little Brother Boulder.

climbs.name: Cholita Sandbaggery AKA The False Arête.

content.description:
Super jug haul with somewhat of a thought provoking start. Can be done a couple different variations.

This would be Yosemite 5.4!
content.location: Obvious juggy arête that makes up South West side of Middle Brother.

content.description: Start with minimal feet, use nice side-pull flake and get up to small jug up left.
content.location: Move around to the left from Pollo Asada, to rear slab section of boulder.  Lots of faded dark spray paint that looks like a Black Cloud.

content.description: Start low and just left of hole that is a seasonal home to a hive of Bees. Move up and right on overhanging bouldery moves, all the way to high point of boulder. Positive lip mantle.
content.location: The Beehive Boulder is the largest western most boulder of the Hill Top Cirque. Just West of Shoot To Kill.  There are Six problems on its Overhanging West Face.  The Beehive is the furthest left problem.

content.description: Beehive Direct is the direct line out of the Beehive. Starting low as possible three moves will get you to the mantle through the V Slot.
content.location: Left side of Beehive Boulder.

content.description: Best climb on this formation. Sit start low on flake, make improbable move up and right to sloper side pull. Gastone left hand to descent hold. Feet to start flake, bump right to dime edge crimp, side pull, set up for big throw to top out holds.
content.location: Directly up Center of Beehives West Face.

content.description: Same as Beehive Barrio, instead of setting up to throw for the top out rail. Continue off right crimp side pull, to a series of grim technical crimps up and right, topping out at apex of boulder.
content.location: Center Face of Beehive Boulder trends right!

content.description: This is the right hand or South Arête of The Beehive Boulder. Sit star low, pull through to good horizontal rail, hand/heel match on horizontal and pull through to the herniating mantel.
content.location: South Arête of formation start low in rodent den.
